editions.flavor: The cacophonous timber of this drum will rile the blood of creatures who hear it.

effect: **Banish Rousing Rattle Drum**: Wake up target defending Animal or Beast ally.
effect_raw: Banish Rousing Rattle Drum: Wake up target defending Animal or Beast ally.
name: Rousing Rattle Drum
effect_html: Banish Rousing Rattle Drum: Wake up target defending Animal or Beast ally.

effect: [Class Bonus] **Banish Hairpin of Transience**: Put three **wither** counters on target non-champion object. *(At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with **wither** counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each **wither** counter on it, then remove **wither** counters.)*
effect_raw: [Class Bonus] Banish Hairpin of Transience: Put three wither counters on target non-champion object. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
name: Hairpin of Transience

rule.description: The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

effect_html: Class Bonus Banish Hairpin of Transience: Put three wither counters on target non-champion object. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay 1for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)

editions.flavor: "Praying for peace won't end a war. Fighting for what you believe in will."
"Praying for peace won't end a war. Fighting for what you believe in will."

effect: **Negate** target card activation unless its controller pays (2). Banish the card that had its activation **negated** this way.
effect_raw: Negate target card activation unless its controller pays (2). Banish the card that had its activation negated this way.
flavor: "O'Lumina who shelters us, bind those who seek us harm in frost. Grant us peace under your blessing."
name: Frostbind

result_editions.flavor: "Praying for peace won't end a war. Fighting for what you believe in will."

rule.description: If Frostbind negates an attack card, the combat phase never gets to begin. This means that On Attack effects will not trigger. The attacker remains rested if resting that unit was an additional cost of that attack card.
The (2) in Frostbind's negate condition is a reserve cost, and can be paid by resting objects with reservable.

effect_html: Negate target card activation unless its controller pays 2. Banish the card that had its activation negated this way.

editions.flavor: "The frost grants me what it takes from you."

editions.effect:
**%Immortal%Immortality%**, **Spellshroud**

[Guo Jia Bonus] At the beginning of your end phase, you may banish a card at random from your memory. If you do, draw a card.

[Guo Jia Bonus] Whenever you banish a card from your memory, put a **quest** counter on your champion. 

[REST]: You may remove ten **quest** counters from your champion. If you do, wake up and transform CARDNAME.
editions.effect_raw:
Immortality, Spellshroud

[Guo Jia Bonus] At the beginning of your end phase, you may banish a card at random from your memory. If you do, draw a card.

[Guo Jia Bonus] Whenever you banish a card from your memory, put a quest counter on your champion. 

REST: You may remove ten quest counters from your champion. If you do, wake up and transform Fabled Azurite Fatestone.

other_orientations.effect:
**Spellshroud**, **Taunt**

[Guo Jia Bonus] **On Attack:** Choose one— 
 • Generate an Arcane Blast card and banish it. As long as it's banished, you may activate it, ignoring its elemental requirements.
 • **Empower X**+2, where **X** is the amount of arcane element cards in your banishment.

[Guo Jia Bonus] At the beginning of your end phase, you may banish a card at random from your memory. If you do, draw a card.

[Guo Jia Bonus] Whenever you banish a card from your memory, put a **quest** counter on your champion. 

[REST]: You may remove ten **quest** counters from your champion. If you do, wake up and transform CARDNAME.
editions.effect_raw:
Immortality, Spellshroud

[Guo Jia Bonus] At the beginning of your end phase, you may banish a card at random from your memory. If you do, draw a card.

[Guo Jia Bonus] Whenever you banish a card from your memory, put a quest counter on your champion. 

REST: You may remove ten quest counters from your champion. If you do, wake up and transform Fabled Azurite Fatestone.

other_orientations.effect:
**Spellshroud**, **Taunt**

[Guo Jia Bonus] **On Attack:** Choose one— 
 • Generate an Arcane Blast card and banish it. As long as it's banished, you may activate it, ignoring its elemental requirements.
 • **Empower X**+2, where **X** is the amount of arcane element cards in your banishment.
other_orientations.effect_raw:
Spellshroud, Taunt

[Guo Jia Bonus] On Attack: Choose one— 
 • Generate an Arcane Blast card and banish it. As long as it's banished, you may activate it, ignoring its elemental requirements.
 • Empower X+2, where X is the amount of arcane element cards in your banishment.
other_orientations.name: Seiryuu, Azure Dragon

If you do, wake up and transform Fabled Azurite Fatestone.

rule.description: The quest counter ability only triggers if the controller is the one banishing a card from their memory. It doesn't trigger if a different player banishes a card from it. For example, the quest counter ability will not trigger from an opponent resolving a Chilling Touch against a player that controls Fabled Azurite Fatestone.
If a transformed double-faced object would enter the graveyard from the field, it goes to the default location that the front would go. In this case, a regalia goes to its owner's banishment.

If you do, wake up and transform Fabled Azurite Fatestone.

effect:
[Diao Chan Bonus] This card costs 3 less to activate.

Put four **wither** counters on target non-champion object. *(At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with **wither** counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each **wither** counter on it, then remove **wither** counters.)*
effect_raw:
[Diao Chan Bonus] This card costs 3 less to activate.

Put four wither counters on target non-champion object. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
name: Frostlorn Caress

rule.description: The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

effect_html: Diao Chan Bonus This card costs 3 less to activate.Put four wither counters on target non-champion object. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay 1for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)

effect:
[Diao Chan Bonus] This card costs 2 less to activate.

Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a **wither** counter on each of them. *(At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with **wither** counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each **wither** counter on it, then remove **wither** counters.)*
effect_raw:
[Diao Chan Bonus] This card costs 2 less to activate.

Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a wither counter on each of them. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
name: Frostnip Pirouette

rule.description: The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

editions.flavor: Foxes in Sanguo were revered for their cleverness, yet despised by some as symbols of debauchery.

effect:
[Class Bonus] This card costs 1 less to materialize.

At the beginning of your recollection phase, if you are the player with the least **influence**, draw a card. *(A player's **influence** is equal to the total amount of cards in their hand and memory.)*
effect_raw:
[Class Bonus] This card costs 1 less to materialize.

At the beginning of your recollection phase, if you are the player with the least influence, draw a card. (A player's influence is equal to the total amount of cards in their hand and memory.)
name: Incandescent Reliquary

rule.description: If you are a player tied for the least influence with one or more other players, the ability will still trigger and resolve.

effect_html: Class Bonus This card costs 1 less to materialize.At the beginning of your recollection phase, if you are the player with the least influence, draw a card. (A player's influence is equal to the total amount of cards in their hand and memory.)

effect:
[Class Bonus] **Efficiency** *(This card costs **LV** less to activate. **LV** refers to your champion's level.)*

Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put two **wither** counters on each of them.
effect_raw:
[Class Bonus] Efficiency (This card costs LV less to activate. LV refers to your champion's level.)

Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put two wither counters on each of them.
name: Ripples of Atrophy

rule.description: The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

effect_html: Class Bonus Efficiency (This card costs LV less to activate. LV refers to your champion's level.)Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put two wither counters on each of them.
